title.narrative: Partners in resilience for small farmers

description.narrative: Indus Consortium is a partner of Oxfam in Pakistan undertaking two major campaigns around climate change and food security, and water governance in Pakistan. GROW campaign is the major campaign in which Indus Consortium is participating in Punjab around food security, and climate change issues. It is working with universities, communities, environmental organizations, provincial ministries, forest department and art groups at Provincial level with the focus on developing food security and climate change policies plans andinstitutional set-ups in Punjab. Climate financing and regional cooperation with universities is also part of campaign work. Indus Consortium is engaging with communities, government authorities and civil society organizations. However there is lack of information and therefore engagement with the Private Sector. Indus Consortium is very keen on engaging private sector in Pakistan in its workrelated to Resilience building. The engagement with private sector will open new windows of opportunities for the most vulnerable and neglected segments of society in terms of building their resilience. The project is a Scooping Study for Private Sector Resilience in Pakistan while simultaneously engaging with the government through developing Budget Primer. This project envisage in building the resilience of small scale farmers, in 22 most vulnerable districts of Pakistan. This will examine the nature, scope and drivers of agribusinesses dependent on agricultural value chains in disaster prone areas in Pakistan, focusing on businesses that work with small-scale farmers and businesses that most affected by disaster risks and climate change impacts. Further it will determine the potential entry points that Oxfam and partners can play a role in, and inform decision making by Oxfam in Pakistan and Oxfam in Asia on what could be done to bring about positive impact to vulnerable communities. Determine the main business development services, especially financial-related ones being offered in these disasters prone areas. Undertake an analysis of current practices of major agri-business and financial service providers for agricultural production and services in terms of resilience to disaster and climate risks and provide a to the point review and top linerecommendations for Oxfam#s business case.

participating-org.narrative:
Indus Consortium - a collaborative platform of 3 humanitarian and development organizations i.e. Laar Humanitarian Development Program (LHDP), Doaba Foundation and HELP Foundation - is a manifestation of a joint force of the people living around Sindhu (Indus) River basin in Pakistan. The consortium represents the unity among various groups of different ethnic, linguistic and geographic features and their resolve to struggle for the development of the people around Indus River basin whose forefathers, in the ancient ages, had developed one of the most prosperous civilizations around the globe; remembered in history as Indus Civilization.
Indus Consortium envisions a democratic and equitable society where all citizens enjoy equal economic, cultural and political rights. Our mission is to works for local communities to enhance their resilience and participation in development.
